intro: Cyclea arnottii, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a member of the茄科 (Solanaceae) family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or greenish flowers. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture. Cyclea arnottii is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Ayurvedic medicine.
